clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Remifentanil and Dexmedetomidine in Patients With Noninvasive Mechanical Ventilation Intolerance
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Remifentanil and Dexmedetomidine in Patients With Noninvasive Mechanical Ventilation Intolerance After Cardiac Surgery: a Multicenter, Prospective, Single-blind, Randomized Controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: Currently, NIV(Noninvasive ventilation ) is widely used in patients with hypoxemia and atelectasis after cardiac surgery.About 15% of patients have intolerance during NIV. The main manifestation is that the patient feels uncomfortable, often breaks away from the mask, and even gradually becomes agitated, which eventually leads to the failure of non-invasive ventilation.The patient's intubation rate is as high as 44%, and the mortality rate is 34%.There are many ways to prevent or treat NIV intolerance, of which the most used is to sedate the patient. This study aims to evaluate the effects of remifentanil and dexmedetomidine in the sedation of patients with intolerance to non-invasive mechanical ventilation after cardiac surgery, and to explore the optimal plan for sedation of patients with intolerant non-invasive mechanical ventilation after cardiac surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Remission rate of intolerance in patients with intolerance of non-invasive mechanical ventilation after cardiac surgery after sedation with remifentanil or dexmedetomidine.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 72 hours of study drug used

secondary_outcome.measure: Mortality in both remifentanil and dexmedetomidine group
Mechanical ventilation time in both remifentanil and dexmedetomidine group
Hemodynamic changes in both remifentanil and dexmedetomidine group
Incidence of delirium in both remifentanil and dexmedetomidine group
Days in ICU in both remifentanil and dexmedetomidine group
Intubation rate in both remifentanil and dexmedetomidine group
Tracheotomy rate in both remifentanil and dexmedetomidine group

intervention.description: Intravenous pump injection.The initial dose of remifentanil is 0.05 μg/kg/min.The drug dosage will be adjusted according to the subjects' intolerance relief (the treatment target is NIS ≤ 2), and the maximum dosage of remifentanil is 0.12 μg/kg/min

Intravenous pump injection.The initial dose of dexmedetomidine is 0.5 μg/kg/h.The drug dosage will be adjusted according to the subjects' intolerance relief (the treatment target is NIS ≤ 2), and the maximum dosage of dexmedetomidine is 1.0 μg/kg/h.
